arts.ttl: Latest pair of Leeds United injury concerns assessed by Daniel Farke after Middlesbrough win
arts.sum: The second half saw Max Wober score an own goal before Daniel James and Brenden Aaronson struck to get the hosts over the line. Follow everything the manager has to say about Tuesday night's match below as we bring you most of the questions and answers in full from the debrief.

arts.ttl: Leeds United weigh up transfer options with Man City 'willing' to sanction January exit
arts.sum: McAtee, among several attacking options the Whites explored in the summer transfer window, could be allowed to leave the reigning Premier League champions in the New Year. The 22-year-old has featured just twice in the Premier League this season since returning from a loan spell with Sheffield United.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick unperturbed by Boro points gap and makes disappointment point
arts.sum: Losing 3-1, it was a game in which the scoreline fairly reflects what was a difficult evening for Boro, and was a deserved win to send Leeds top, on the balance. Small margins can often have massive consequences in football and that certainly feels the case for Middlesbrough after their defeat to Leeds United on Tuesday evening.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough star and ex-Leeds United hero agree on penalty verdict as clear VAR point made
arts.sum: Rodon's tackle was discussed in the Sky Sports studio - with Smith and Brown clearly in agreement that Boro should have been given a penalty. Although there was a small lull after Boro's equaliser, Leeds found a second wind and they re-took the lead in the 74th minute, with Daniel James firing home into the top corner.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Dan James marks milestone as Leeds return to top
arts.sum: Gnonto also on target in 3-1 win against Middlesbrough Sunderland grab late equaliser to peg back Bristol City Dan James marked his 100th Leeds appearance with a crucial goal as his side beat Middlesbrough 3-1 at Elland Road to regain top spot in the Championship. James fired home in the second half after Max Wöber’s own goal had cancelled out Wilfried Gnonto’s opener. Brenden Aaronson added Leeds’s third in added time. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick says Middlesbrough must take one thing away from Leeds United loss
arts.sum: We had a really good spell and looked and felt like we could go on and win the game. But turning the dial after the break, they got an early equaliser from a Max Wober own goal and for a short spell looked the most likely side to go and win the game.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough chief Michael Carrick addresses controversial penalty call after Leeds United loss
arts.sum: Head coach Michael Carrick refused to criticise the match officials after watching his Middlesbrough side fall to a 3-1 defeat away to promotion rivals Leeds United this evening. When quizzed on the flashpoint, Middlesbrough chief Carrick said: "I've not seen it to be honest so I don't know.

arts.ttl: 0/6 dribbles: I just watched Leeds United ace completely bully Championship sensation for 90 minutes
arts.sum: However, despite largely dominating the opening 45 minutes, Leeds allowed ‘Boro back into the game through a corner aimed at the near post and turned into his own goal by Max Wöber. Leeds United are back on top of the league and three clear of third with victory over Middlesbrough, a 3-1 win at Elland Road.

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke left 'exhausted' after Middlesbrough triumph as Leeds United boss salutes players
arts.sum: Daniel Farke was left "exhausted" after Leeds United's enthralling home win over Middlesbrough. Everything looked rosy for the Whites at half-time as they led 1-0 after a scrappy close range finish from Wilfried Gnonto following excellent work down from the right flank from Daniel James.

arts.ttl: Leeds overpower Boro to go top of Championship
arts.sum: Dan James marked his 100th Leeds appearance with a crucial goal as his side beat Middlesbrough 3-1 at Elland Road to regain top spot in the Sky Bet Championship.
